net.proteusframework.core.spring

Class ApplicationContextUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.core.spring.ApplicationContextUtils

  • public class ApplicationContextUtils
extends Object
    Utilities for getting an application context.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Method Detail

      • getContext

        @Nullable
public ApplicationContext getContext()
        Get the application context. If no context has been set an XML context will be loaded from the location specified in the Java system property "spring.context.location". If this property is not set the default location of "/applicationContext.xml" will be used.
        Returns:
        ApplicationContext or null if starting.

      • getContext

        @Nullable
public ApplicationContext getContext(String locationHint)
        Get the application context. In general it is best not to use this method but use getContext(). The location can be set through a Java system property. This method should normally be used for unit tests.
        Parameters:
        locationHint - a hint to the location of the context. Usually a classpath, file, or Java class implementing Configuration.
        Returns:
        ApplicationContext or null if unable to create one.

      • getInstance

        public static ApplicationContextUtils getInstance()
        Get an instance.
        Returns:
        ApplicationContextUtils.

      • isContextAvailable

        public boolean isContextAvailable()
        Check if the context has been loaded.
        Returns:
        true if the context has been loaded.

      • isStarting

        public boolean isStarting()
        Check if the context is starting.
        Returns:
        true if starting; otherwise false.

      • setContext

        public void setContext(ApplicationContext context)
        Set the application context. This will be set automatically by I2RDApplicationEventMulticaster
        Parameters:
        context - the context.

      • setStarting

        public void setStarting(boolean value)
        Mark the context as starting. Internal Use.
        Parameters:
        value - the value.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop the ApplicationContext.
